update.description: This PR removes the need to preemptively set `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH` to where the downloaded model will land.
update.title: Upgrade to fuel-tools1 and automatically update paths -> pull request #2800

pull_request.title: Upgrade to fuel-tools1 and automatically update paths -> pull request #2800

pullrequest.title: Upgrade to fuel-tools1 and automatically update paths -> pull request #2800

content.raw: Good points. I think the cleanest solution would involve having a single entry-point to look for any kind of resource (meshes, textures, material files, models, plugins, worlds...). This should then look at local paths and only afterwards at online databases. I think classes like `physics::World`  shouldn't be worrying about where resources are coming from.
content.html: Good points. I think the cleanest solution would involve having a single entry-point to look for any kind of resource (meshes, textures, material files, models, plugins, worlds...). This should then look at local paths and only afterwards at online databases. I think classes like physics::World shouldn't be worrying about where resources are coming from.

pull_request.title: Upgrade to fuel-tools1 and automatically update paths -> pull request #2800

pullrequest.title: Upgrade to fuel-tools1 and automatically update paths -> pull request #2800

content.raw: In addition to setting path, we'll also need to let the gzserver know to download models from fuel instead of the existing model database if it's not already there. A quick search for `"ModelDatabase::Instance.*Get"` shows a couple more places where it's used:  [World.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/bcbea7608b1ad88067ef652e8e7a4b93ec1001cf/gazebo/physics/World.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#World.cc-1951) and [SystemPaths.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/bcbea7608b1ad88067ef652e8e7a4b93ec1001cf/gazebo/common/SystemPaths.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#SystemPaths.cc-320). We'll somehow need to be able to identify which database the model is located and download from the right one.
content.html: In addition to setting path, we'll also need to let the gzserver know to download models from fuel instead of the existing model database if it's not already there. A quick search for "ModelDatabase::Instance.*Get" shows a couple more places where it's used: World.cc and SystemPaths.cc. We'll somehow need to be able to identify which database the model is located and download from the right one.

pull_request.title: Upgrade to fuel-tools1 and automatically update paths -> pull request #2800

pullrequest.title: Upgrade to fuel-tools1 and automatically update paths -> pull request #2800

content.raw:
I just uploaded a model to fuel which is not in gazebo_models, so it's easier to test making sure Gazebo can't fetch the resources from somewhere else:

https://ignitionfuel.org/chapulinaaa/models/Wastebasket

And indeed, gzserver can't find it with this patch. Ticketed issue #2403, I'll decline this.

Independently of the approach we decide to take for Fuel, I think we will need to use gazebo/ignition transport to communicate the new paths to gzserver for the editors and the "Add Path" button.
content.html:
I just uploaded a model to fuel which is not in gazebo_models, so it's easier to test making sure Gazebo can't fetch the resources from somewhere else:

https://ignitionfuel.org/chapulinaaa/models/Wastebasket

And indeed, gzserver can't find it with this patch. Ticketed issue #2403, I'll decline this.

Independently of the approach we decide to take for Fuel, I think we will need to use gazebo/ignition transport to communicate the new paths to gzserver for the editors and the "Add Path" button.

pull_request.title: Upgrade to fuel-tools1 and automatically update paths -> pull request #2800

pullrequest.title: Upgrade to fuel-tools1 and automatically update paths -> pull request #2800

content.raw:
The user would only end up here if they're actively using the experimental feature, and this would only append paths, not affecting previous paths.

But fair enough, this can be changed after the release and shouldn't break ABI. I propose the change to v1 be made directly on pull request #2800 and leave this here for further review after the Gazebo 9 release.

I'll also point out I don't think this is the most elegant solution. For example, I think it would be much more maintainable if fuel knew how to look at every user subfolder under `~/.ignition/fuel/models`instead of needing to add each of them to the path.
content.html:
The user would only end up here if they're actively using the experimental feature, and this would only append paths, not affecting previous paths.

But fair enough, this can be changed after the release and shouldn't break ABI. I propose the change to v1 be made directly on pull request #2800 and leave this here for further review after the Gazebo 9 release.

I'll also point out I don't think this is the most elegant solution. For example, I think it would be much more maintainable if fuel knew how to look at every user subfolder under ~/.ignition/fuel/modelsinstead of needing to add each of them to the path.

content.raw:
Thanks for the clarification. Automatically changing paths based on an experimental feature is also not a good idea.

This is falling into the category of a new feature on code-freeze day. Can we scope the PR back to just using `ign-fuel-tools` version 1?
content.html:
Thanks for the clarification. Automatically changing paths based on an experimental feature is also not a good idea.

This is falling into the category of a new feature on code-freeze day. Can we scope the PR back to just using ign-fuel-tools version 1?

pull_request.title: Upgrade to fuel-tools1 and automatically update paths -> pull request #2800

pullrequest.title: Upgrade to fuel-tools1 and automatically update paths -> pull request #2800

content.raw:
I think with the current implementation, the user needs to set the path even before opening Gazebo, predicting if they will insert a file from fuel, so I'd say the feature is currently unusable.

Ian's point about gzserver is valid, I'll investigate a bit, because as I understand it, we've  never had resource problems with models created in the model  editor, I think collision meshes are properly found and textures re visible to cameras.
content.html:
I think with the current implementation, the user needs to set the path even before opening Gazebo, predicting if they will insert a file from fuel, so I'd say the feature is currently unusable.

Ian's point about gzserver is valid, I'll investigate a bit, because as I understand it, we've never had resource problems with models created in the model editor, I think collision meshes are properly found and textures re visible to cameras.

content.raw: This doesn't  open a dialog, it only saves paths and updates gui.ini. As mentioned on the TODO, the functionality is not exclusive to the dialog and could be moved to a separate file

pullrequest.title: Upgrade to fuel-tools1 and automatically update paths -> pull request #2800

content.raw:
Opening a save dialog box when inserting a model deserves some planning. I'd like to spend some time thinking about how to make Fuel user-friendly.

The release of Fuel into Gazebo9 should be considered experimental. Requiring a few extra steps by a user is okay. I'd rather see the message output instead of a save dialog.
content.html:
Opening a save dialog box when inserting a model deserves some planning. I'd like to spend some time thinking about how to make Fuel user-friendly.

The release of Fuel into Gazebo9 should be considered experimental. Requiring a few extra steps by a user is okay. I'd rather see the message output instead of a save dialog.

content.raw: Actually I'm not sure how it works considering gzserver and gzclient are separate processes even when running in the same computer. This  is what we do when  a user saves a model at an arbitrary path with the model editor.
content.html: Actually I'm not sure how it works considering gzserver and gzclient are separate processes even when running in the same computer. This is what we do when a user saves a model at an arbitrary path with the model editor.
